title: Public gardens and trees
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Television
description: Episode number 6 of Series "Gardens of the world". Host Audrey Hepburn explores the beautifully restored gardens at Mt. Vernon, originally created for the private pleasures of one of America's first great gardeners, George Washington. This garden stands today as one of America's most charming public gardens. Audrey Hepburn presents the diversity and wealth of public gardens in the city of Paris, among them, intimate 'pocket-parks', former grand royal gardens and spectacular pleasure gardens. Narrated by Michael York.
related_objects: Series; S01173; Gardens of the world; Active; 1993
